subject: Add BIOS attributes in server power operations page
commitMessage:
Add BIOS attributes in server power operations page

- This page will show the BIOS options (IBM only)
- APIs used are:
  - To get the BIOS attributes '/redfish/v1/Systems/system/Bios'
  - To get the values of BIOS attributes '/redfish/v1/Registries/BiosAttributeRegistry/BiosAttributeRegistry'
  - To save the updated BIOS attributes '/redfish/v1/Systems/system/Bios/Settings'

Signed-off-by: Sukanya Pandey <sukapan1@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ifb1e5e3ec9449270d25df7faacf96073a93b1268

Very good job!

Abandoned

This change is IBM only
Please don't hardcode URIs like this.  It prevents our ability to migrate URIs in the future, and is against the redfish specification.
We are moving this to GHE
Same here.
Same here.
Please don't hardcode path names in new code.  It makes it difficult to support things like caching later, as well as is explicitly disallowed in the redfish spec.
Same as above.
Same as above.
Why are we using empty string as initial value not null?
null is used for objects, for strings/numbers default value is empty string.
Ack
I see.
For better readability can we perform this filtering in separate method or maybe leave a comment?
Done
It can be seen that the strings 'Manual' and 'Normal' are used at many places. Can we store them in a const variable and then use it?
Done
